skill.name: helm-chart-scaffolding
skill.description: Design, organize, and manage Helm charts for templating and packaging Kubernetes applications with reusable configurations. Use when creating Helm charts, packaging Kubernetes applications, or implementing templated deployments.
skill.summary: Design, organize, and manage Helm charts for templating and packaging Kubernetes applications with r...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation and guidance skill for Helm chart development. Contains a validation script that runs local Helm commands for linting, templating, and dry-run installation. All 198 static findings are false positives triggered by documentation code blocks, standard Helm repository URLs, and legitimate YAML parsing operations. No malicious intent detected.

content.value_statement: Creating Helm charts from scratch can be complex with many conventions to follow. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for building production-ready Helm charts. It includes chart structure, templating patterns, values management, and validation strategies.
actual_capabilities: Design complete Helm chart structure with Chart.yaml and values.yaml files
Create Kubernetes manifest templates using Go templating syntax
Implement template helpers for reusable naming and labeling patterns
Configure multi-environment deployments with separate values files
Validate charts with helm lint, template, and dry-run commands
Manage chart dependencies and create chart repositories
limitations: Does not install or manage Helm on the local system
Does not connect to Kubernetes clusters directly
Does not deploy charts to running clusters

use_cases.title: Standardize Chart Creation
use_cases.description: Create consistent, production-ready Helm charts across your organization with best practice templates and validation.

use_cases.title: Package Applications
use_cases.description: Package Kubernetes applications for distribution with proper versioning, documentation, and dependency management.

use_cases.title: Multi-Environment Deployments
use_cases.description: Manage configuration across development, staging, and production environments using Helm values files.

prompt_templates.title: New Chart
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new Helm chart for my application. Include deployment, service, and ingress templates.

prompt_templates.title: Add Template
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a ConfigMap template to my existing Helm chart that reads configuration from the values.yaml file.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Env
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up multi-environment configuration for my Helm chart with separate values files for dev, staging, and production.

prompt_templates.title: Validate Chart
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my Helm chart structure and templates. Check for security best practices, resource limits, and health probes.

output_examples.input: Create a Helm chart for my API application with PostgreSQL dependency
output: Chart.yaml configured with name, version, appVersion, and PostgreSQL dependency from Bitnami charts
values.yaml with image configuration, replicaCount, service settings, and PostgreSQL auth credentials
templates/deployment.yaml with container ports, environment variables, and resource limits
templates/service.yaml with ClusterIP type and target port configuration
templates/_helpers.tpl with naming conventions and label helpers

output_examples.input: Set up multi-environment Helm configuration for my app
output: Base values.yaml with default configuration for all environments
values-dev.yaml with development settings (lower replicas, larger resources for debugging)
values-prod.yaml with production settings (higher replicas, resource limits, autoscaling)

output_examples.input: Validate my Helm chart for security best practices
output: Chart structure validation (Chart.yaml, values.yaml, templates directory present)
Security checks: runAsNonRoot, readOnlyRootFilesystem, privilege escalation disabled
Helm lint and dry-run validation passed

best_practices: Use semantic versioning for chart versions separate from application versions
Pin dependency versions exactly to ensure reproducible deployments
Include health probes and resource limits in all deployments
anti_patterns: Using latest image tags without pinning versions
Hardcoding sensitive values in values.yaml instead of using external secrets
Skipping helm lint validation before packaging charts

faq.question: What Helm version is required?
faq.answer: This skill supports Helm 3 and later. Helm 3 introduced API version v2 which is the default format used.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. The validation script can be integrated into CI pipelines to lint and test charts before packaging and deployment.

faq.question: Does this skill access or store any data?
faq.answer: No. This is a pure guidance skill. It reads chart files locally for validation but stores no data externally.

faq.question: Why is my template failing to render?
faq.answer: Common issues include missing required values, incorrect template syntax, or referencing undefined values. Use helm template --debug.

faq.question: How does this compare to helm create?
faq.answer: helm create generates a starter chart. This skill provides deeper understanding of structure, best practices, and customization patterns.

faq.question: What chart validations are performed?
faq.answer: The skill validates chart structure, runs helm lint, tests template rendering, checks security best practices, and verifies resource configuration.
